name: Bear Tooth Lodge
rentalCondition:
PROPERTY CONDITIONS 

AGE REQUIREMENT:  Guest is at least twenty-five (25) years of age.  Guest is responsible for all other guests and visitors of the rental property during the reservation.  

PAYMENT:  50% of the total reservation amount is due at time of booking.  30 Days prior to arrival, the balance is due.  Should final payment not be made 30 days prior to arrival, the reservation may be cancelled, and any payment made becomes non-refundable.  

LIMITED OCCUPANCY:  Maximum occupancy is limited to the number of individuals listed on the reservation.  If the host concludes that this policy has been breached, Host reserves the right to expel the entire party with no refund.  

TERM OF RENTAL AGREEMENT:  The Rental Agreement begins at 4:00 p.m. on Check-in Date and ends at 11:00 a.m. on Check out Date.  Early check-ins or late check-outs are subject to approval.  

CANCELLATION POLICY:  Guests who cancel at least 30 days before check-in will get back 100% of the amount.  Should a reservation be rescheduled at the request of the guest or recommendation of the Host, and then cancelled, the payment made would not be refundable.  

SMOKING:  No smoking inside the property.  A minimum fee of $250 will be assessed if smoking in the property is detected.  

PARKING:  Is restricted to the properties designated spaces.  Do not park in neighboring properties or in the road. 

REFUNDS:  Guest hereby agrees and acknowledges that guest shall not be entitled to a refund in the event guest departs before the end of the reservation or guest arrives late.  Furthermore, any refund or compensation for the occurrence of any and all events out of the control of Owners, including but not limited to, Acts of God, weather conditions, power outages, water outages, mechanical failure of appliances and electronics, heat and air will be at the sole discretion of Owners.  Mountain roads can be curvy and steep.  Gravel drives and roads are well maintained; however, it is highly recommended to have four-wheel drive or chains on two-wheel-drive vehicles.  No refunds will be given due to road conditions. 

HOSTS RIGHTS:  Guest agrees that if the conditions and limitations set forth herein are not met, Host shall have the right to cancel this agreement and may enter the Property, either by statutory proceedings or by force, to inspect the Property and ensure that Guest has vacated the Property.  All monies paid by the Guest shall be forfeited as liquidated damages.  

INDEMNIITY CLAUSE:  Guest hereby agrees to indemnify and hold Host harmless from all claims, including those of third parties, arising out of or in any way related to Guest’s use of Property or the items of personal property provided therein.  Guest assumes all risk of injury or other losses relating to any recreational activities, including use of hot tub on the Property and will hold Host harmless with respect therein.  

REPAIRS AND MAINTENANCE:  This property is reserved wit the Host’s furniture and household furnishings.  Host shall not be responsible for providing additional furnishings or equipment not presently available in Property.  Guest will report any maintenance issues immediately to the Host.  Host will make every effort to repair and/or replace any equipment that is not working property but cannot guarantee that all equipment will be in good operating order at all times and no rate adjustments or refund will be made for equipment or appliance failures.  

USE OF RENTAL PROPERTY:  Guest shall occupy and use the rental property in a manner that shall not disturb or offend neighbors of the rental property. 

SENSITIVE MOUNTAIN SEPTIC:  Toilets:  The following items are NOT to be flushed down the toilets.  Baby wipes, facial wipes, diapers, tampons or any feminine products, Q-Tips, excessive toilet paper.  Should a toilet overflow and the plumber determines the cause was by any of the above items, guest will be charged the entire service call plus time and effort by owners.  Use the trash cans located beside the toilets.  

CARE OF PREMISES/DAMAGES:  NO PET PROPERTIES AND NO SMOKING – Violation of these or any of the House Rules constitutes grounds for automatic eviction plus forfeit of all payments and all booking/reservation costs if violated.   Guest agrees to pay Host for any damages to the property, grounds, furnishings, household items, hot tubs caused by Guest during its occupancy.  This will include payment of any additional cleaning charges incurred due to Guests  occupancy.   

PETS:  Depending on the property, well behaved adult dogs are considered.  No cats.  $100.00 non-refundable pet fee will be charged per stay.  Should your pet cause any damage or additional housekeeping is required for “accidents” in the house, additional costs will be incurred.    

BEFORE DEPARTING:  Please do the following before departing the property:  
1.	Furniture - If you moved it, please put it back. 
2.	Remote controls - make sure all remote controls are left visible in each room with a television, DVD player or other devices using a remote control.  
3.	Netflix and Streaming Services  - if you signed into your home accounts, remember to sign out.  
4.	Dishes, pots, pans, etc., must be washed and put away for the next guest.  If the Property has a dishwasher, please load, and turn it on.  
5.	Beds - If you slept in the bed, just leave it unmade.  DO NOT strip beds
6.	Towels - leave used towels in the bathtub, shower or on the floor.
7.	Lights, fans, and appliances should be turned off. 
8.	Garbage must be bagged and placed in the outside cans or containers or left inside the property.  
9.	Fireplaces - extinguish all fires in fireplaces and make sure safety screens are closed or in place. 	
10.	Thermostats - During cool season, set thermostat at 55 degrees upon departure

RESTRICTIONS:  The following activities are not permitted within the boundaries of the residential community or resort:  
1.	ATVs or snowmobiles* (Southern Properties excluded from this restriction)
2.	Discharge of firearms or use of archery tackle*
3.	Hunting or trapping*
4.	Outside fires, fireworks or any combustible substance are absolutely prohibited**
5.	Excessive noise that disrupts, disturbs, annoys, or offends neighbors*
6.	Sound curfew is 7:30 pm*
7.	Large recreational vehicles or large trailers 
a.	(Northern Properties – The roads are too narrow) 
8.	Parking anywhere except designated parking.  No street parking or parking in neighboring cabins or condos
9.	Open fires are strictly restricted outside – no firepits, bonfires or any such version of these and will be fined $2,500.00.

FINES OF UP TO $1,000.00 MAY BE ASSESSED FOR PROHIBITED ACTIVITES

Guest and Host, by signing this Rental Agreement acknowledges that they will comply with the terms of this Agreement and each assumes the responsibility for the obligations set forth herein.  Guest acknowledges receipt of the House Rules.  Guest acknowledges that they have read, accepts, and agrees to the terms set forth.
cancellationPolicy: Guests who cancel at least 30 days before check-in will get back 100% of the amount they've paid minus 5% credit card processing fees.  If they cancel between 14 and 30 days before check-in, they'll get back 50% minus 5% credit card processing fees.  Otherwise, they won't get a refund.

description.name: Bear Tooth Lodge • Sundance, Utah
description.shortSummary: New vacation rental - Family Friendly - Fun, Cozy Mountain Cabin
description.summary: Bear Tooth Lodge - Secluded and nestled in the trees yet minutes from the adventures the mountain has to offer.  This four-bedroom  escape in Sundance, Utah, is just the place to bring families and friends.  This cabin has it all, fireplace,  magnificant views, beautiful outside space, hot tub, swings, two kitchens, a game room and loads of beds for all AND kid friendly with fun "hidden" escape rooms for spaces all their own.  Come and make some memories.
description.notes: Located in a gated community within a five minute drive to the  Sundance Resort, you will find award winning restaurants, winter and summer activies, music, art studio, gift shop, spa and the local Sundance community.  Close by is horseback riding, snow shoing, skiing, hiking, ziplining, fly fishing there's so much to do.
description.access: You'll have access to the entire space at Bear Tooth Lodge.  Enjoy it all!
description.transit:
Car Rental is best.  
WINTER - From November 1st until March 31st, four wheel or all wheel drive is mandatory.
description.interaction: We live on the mountain and you call anytime with questions and concerns you may have.  If you can't find something or need something, please call.  Your time away is valuable and we appreciate you coming to stay with us.

amenities.title: Private Cabin
amenities.description: Enjoy complete, romantic privacy to the Carriage House in it's own quite little canyon on a private lane along the stream.

amenities.title: Parking
amenities.description: Easy private parking is provided at the Carriage House and is paved and maintained year round.

amenities.title: 1 Queen Sized Bed +1 Sleeper Sofa
amenities.description: Enjoy luxury comfort on this quality mattress but be warned: You may not want to go back home, and this bed won't fit in your carry on luggage 🙂

amenities.title: Walk to Sundance Mountain Resort
amenities.description: About 3 minutes easy walk from Sundance Mountain Resort, voted "Utah's Best Resort 2017" by Conde` Nest Traveler.

amenities.title: Jacuzzi / Hot Tub
amenities.description: Spend the days exploring Sundance Mountain Resort and all the hikes, biking, skiing, fly fishing and sights in the area, then relax those tired muscles in your own, private hot tub jacuzzi.

amenities.title: Amazing Views
amenities.description: The Carriage House is surrounded by Big Pines and a beautiful, year round steam creating views from the deck that our guests describe as "story book views" they can't believe actually exist.

amenities.title: Propane BBQ Grill
amenities.description: Dine out at Sundance Resort Restaurants like The Tree Room, Foundry Grill, or the Owl Bar, or... Grill and dine in with your own propane BBQ grill just outside the door.

amenities.title: Find More on Instagram
amenities.description: Check out other guest's experience and share your own by searching & tagging your photos with #mtcabinsutguest & @mtcabinsutguide. We can't wait to meet you!!!

gallery.description: The Carriage House.  A beautiful place to come to make memories.
Your home away from home right by the stream.
DISH Network satellite television programming.   Comfy robes.
Queen size adjustable bed with access to outside covered large deck.
The best night sleep is awaiting you.  Black out drapes for a good nights sleep.
Disconnect and connect with those your love.
Common area, bedroom and bathroom plus butler's kitchen.
Butler's Kitchen - Mini fridge, Keurig coffee machine, toaster oven, serving ware.
Armoire houses a Smart TV, games, card, checkers, books & games.
Microwave, small sink, glassware.
One of a kind petrified wood sink .  Radiant heated floors in winter.
Large walk in shower.  Comfy robes.  It's a PULL shower handle.
Our custom spiral staircase provides truly Instagram worthy photo ops & an extra access point to the Carriage House
Your second deck with propane fire pit is great for making smores or just telling stories and enjoying each other.
Want to really enjoy the steam?  We have a bench for that...
Your view from the bed.  You won't find anything better than this for less!
Enjoy your morning beverage of choice overlooking the stream
Stream side walk to hot tub.  Hot tub will be private during your stay.
Outdoor shower
Enjoy a steaming outdoor shower after your relaxing soak in the hot tub
The best part of waking up in the mountains is this!
Enjoy unlimited access to the hot tub just across the stream from the Carriage House.
Ascend the one of a kind circularstaircase to get to the larger deck and bedroom.
With two covered decks to choose from, you'll find a new favorite sitting spot every day!
Bring your marshmallows, chocolate, and gram crackers to make s'mores on the fire.
The many faces of Mount Timpanogos...  It's a different personality from one minute to the next and we're convinced these are the best views in any resort in Utah!
Enjoy the fire, the soothing stream, and the gourmet air of the mountains just outside on one of two private decks.
Your breakfast nook is a cozy breakfast deck that looks out the hot tub and Big Pine Lodge.
Two covered decks provide comfortable access to the fresh mountain air
Covered deck to park your car with a  circular staircase up to the entrance.
The Hot Tub is located up the your own private pathway across the stream on the adjacent property.  It has an outdoor shower.   Your privacy is always respected

description.name: Carriage House on The Stream • Sundance, Utah
description.shortSummary: Carriage House on The Stream • Sundance, Utah
description.summary: Time for a couple's getaway, a personal timeout or attend business meetings?  This is where you want to be.  Fresh mountain air, a stream, comfortable bedding, and essentials are all here!  A short drive up Provo Canyon brings you to the little slice of heaven in Big Pine Canyon in Sundance, Utah.  The world-class restaurants at the Resort or Owl Bar provide gathering places for your business or pleasure dining & entertainment - and your drive is 3 minutes.
description.notes: Walking distance to Sundance Mountain Resort
description.access: This upstairs suite is entirely available for your use including the two outside decks.  There is a hot tub and outside shower at the main house - 30 yards away and is available for your private use.  The laundry facilities are on the main floor and available for you to use as well.  The shower is seasonal and is useable after the snow ends.
description.transit: The best form of transportation to have here in Sundance is your own vehicle.  Winter travel (November thru April) requires four wheel, all wheel or chains.
description.interaction:
We live here on the mountain and in the main house on this property.   
We are always available by phone or text for any questions, recommendations and assistance you might need.
description.neighbourhood: A three minute drive or a ten minute walk to Sundance Resort and the award winning restaurants to satisfy all your dining needs.  The Foundry Grill, breakfast, lunch and dinner; the TreeRoom, dinner only for that special event; the Owl Bar with burgers and great bar food and the best staff  ever (music on weekends - adults only); and the Deli for sandwiches, soup, coffee, smoothies and yummy cookies and pastries.
description.space: Private entrance, up the stairs and you are in your own one bedroom suite.  Designated office space is hidden in the armoire for your convenience and necessary office time.  Check your email, work on presentations all the while looking out at the stream!

description.name: Cottage On The Stream • Sundance, Utah
description.shortSummary: Cottage On The Stream • Sundance, Utah
description.summary:
Cozy, Rustic, Comfortable Cottage on the Stream.  Everyone loves this cabin and its charm with great space for families and friends to gather.  Room to roam and play outside & have a wonderful time.   

Located at the end of a private road, you are nestled between the stream, tall, majestic pine trees, and solitude - yet you are five minutes from the Resort at Sundance, ski lift, hiking, biking, zip line and do not forget the Spa and the amazing restaurants.
description.notes: When you walk to the entrance of The Cottage you will see two trees growing side by side by the front door. Under the front windows in the spring the day lilies are like a sea of yellow gently blowing in the gentle breezes.  There is a bench by the front door and the meadow is alive with creatures big and small.  The turkeys meander through the property pecking at who knows what every day. In the spring the babies hustle behind their mommas.  The deer drink from the stream, hanging out and then disappear in the trees. In the spring the meadow twinkles with butterflies of all colors and the hummingbirds begin looking for nectar.  The plastic flowers in the window box are reminiscent of times and people passed that were the guardians of this place.
description.access: This entire cabin plus the beautiful deck overlooking the stream are yours to enjoy.
description.transit:
Sundance Resort is a mere 1.2 miles away.  A super quick drive or nice walk in the summer.  November through April requires four wheel or all wheel drive vehicles.  Please check with the hosts.

Driveway parks two comfortably and space directly in front of Cabin is available.  
Respectfully request no parking at neighboring cabins  or in the road.
description.interaction: Living on the mountain and only a five minute walk away, we are available for any and all questions or concerns you may have.  Just give us a call.
description.neighbourhood: You're in the heart of the beautiful Wasatch mountains.  Mount Timpanogas  stands tall over Sundance while gorgeous pine trees are everywhere you look.  Take a seat next to stream, breathe in the mountain air and relax.
description.space:
The Cottage on the Stream sits at the end of Old Bridge Road amidst the tall pine trees, next to the stream overlooking a meadow. How sweet is that? Secluded in the forest, no main road with traffic or sounds of traffic, you have the illusion of being far, far away.

The meadow and the property are big enough to let the kids roam outside and play. Bring along your well behaved canine companion* and everyone have a great play day together. (Read pet guidelines for safety of your pet and compliance with the property and Sundance guidelines).

The Cottage is a comfortable place to stay.  The living room has two new Laz-E-Boy power leather recliners plus a very comfortable leather couch, and a couch from the 60s that everyone loves. The wood burning, super efficient fireplace provides the primary heat source and you will enjoy its sights, sounds, heat and warmth without all the work of an open fireplace.  Super easy to start your fire and then keep it going.   Your wood is provided plus instructions for building your fire.  

The kitchen is small but mighty. The kitchen window looks directly out onto the stream and multiple tables allow for kid tables, adult tables, outside tables and rail dining. Coffee maker, citrus juicer, griddle for blueberry pancakes, blender, crock pot, pots and pans, dishes are all provided. (Paper plates also). Spices and pantry essentials are also provided. 

The family room has a twin size day bed/trundle for sleeping 2 and a sleeper sofa.  This is a great place to watch a movie under the snugglies. A table for eating or playing games, plus a cabinet of books, movies, puzzles and games will keep everyone entertained. Lots of windows let in natural light so you feel like you are living outdoors and the back door leads right to the redwood deck. 

Upstairs is amazing. The entire area is devoted to sleeping locations. It is dormitory style (no doors) - see pictures for clarity.  The Queen's Space has a queen bed, with a window at the head of the bed overlooking  the stream.  The middle section is affectionately called the Bedroom of the Six Dwarfs with six twin beds arranged.  Six twin beds are arranged so kids and not so little kids can be close enough for midnight whispers but not so close they are cramped. The King Den features a king size bed, a rocking chair by the window and a baby crib if needed. Two windows brings in the morning sun, the nighttime moon and the sounds of the stream. 

The redwood deck with the top rail designed for dining,  tables and chairs and the hot tub give everyone space be together.   There's a mini bridge for crossing the stream plus a fallen tree that invites you to walk across or sit in the middle and contemplate. 

The Cottage is minutes by car and walking distance to Sundance Resort and the ski slopes, spa, restaurants and evening entertainment at the Owl Bar. A list of ongoing and current events at Sundance will be provided to help make your stay enjoyable. You really never have to leave the mountain. However, if you love the Best Snow on Earth and want to visit the other ski resorts, you are 45 minutes to Park City, Deer Valley and The Canyons. 60 minutes to Alta, Snow Bird, Brighton and Solitude. 

The property has plenty of parking. 

As is typical for all Utah winter mountain driving, access may require 4-wheel drive or chains on a 2-wheel drive vehicle between November 1st and March 31st.  

Cancellation Policy: If written notice of cancellation is received by 5:00 MST, 30 days prior to reservation check in date, we will refund a full deposit less a $50 cancellation fee and a 3.4% processing fee. No refunds are offered for cancellations with less than 30 days notification, or 60 days for the winter holiday seasonal pricing. Check outs prior to the reserved dates are not eligible for a refund. A valid credit card will be kept on file for any damages, missing items or excessive cleaning.

name: Eagle Point Ski Resort  Nº13 Wooded Ridge Condos
rentalCondition:
PROPERTY CONDITIONS 

AGE REQUIREMENT:  Guest is at least twenty-five (25) years of age.  Guest is responsible for all other guests and visitors of the rental property during the reservation.  

PAYMENT:  50% of the total reservation amount is due at time of booking.  30 Days prior to arrival, the balance is due.  Should final payment not be made 30 days prior to arrival, the reservation may be cancelled, and any payment made becomes non-refundable.  

LIMITED OCCUPANCY:  Maximum occupancy is limited to the number of individuals listed on the reservation.  If the host concludes that this policy has been breached, Host reserves the right to expel the entire party with no refund.  

TERM OF RENTAL AGREEMENT:  The Rental Agreement begins at 4:00 p.m. on Check-in Date and ends at 11:00 a.m. on Check out Date.  Early check-ins or late check-outs are subject to approval.  

CANCELLATION POLICY:  Guests who cancel at least 30 days before check-in will get back 100% of the amount.  Should a reservation be rescheduled at the request of the guest or recommendation of the Host, and then cancelled, the payment made would not be refundable.  

SMOKING:  No smoking inside the property.  A minimum fee of $250 will be assessed if smoking in the property is detected.  

PARKING:  Is restricted to the properties designated spaces.  Do not park in neighboring properties or in the road. 

REFUNDS:  Guest hereby agrees and acknowledges that guest shall not be entitled to a refund in the event guest departs before the end of the reservation or guest arrives late.  Furthermore, any refund or compensation for the occurrence of any and all events out of the control of Owners, including but not limited to, Acts of God, weather conditions, power outages, water outages, mechanical failure of appliances and electronics, heat and air will be at the sole discretion of Owners.  Mountain roads can be curvy and steep.  Gravel drives and roads are well maintained; however, it is highly recommended to have four-wheel drive or chains on two-wheel-drive vehicles.  No refunds will be given due to road conditions. 

HOSTS RIGHTS:  Guest agrees that if the conditions and limitations set forth herein are not met, Host shall have the right to cancel this agreement and may enter the Property, either by statutory proceedings or by force, to inspect the Property and ensure that Guest has vacated the Property.  All monies paid by the Guest shall be forfeited as liquidated damages.  

INDEMNIITY CLAUSE:  Guest hereby agrees to indemnify and hold Host harmless from all claims, including those of third parties, arising out of or in any way related to Guest’s use of Property or the items of personal property provided therein.  Guest assumes all risk of injury or other losses relating to any recreational activities, including use of hot tub on the Property and will hold Host harmless with respect therein.  

REPAIRS AND MAINTENANCE:  This property is reserved wit the Host’s furniture and household furnishings.  Host shall not be responsible for providing additional furnishings or equipment not presently available in Property.  Guest will report any maintenance issues immediately to the Host.  Host will make every effort to repair and/or replace any equipment that is not working property but cannot guarantee that all equipment will be in good operating order at all times and no rate adjustments or refund will be made for equipment or appliance failures.  

USE OF RENTAL PROPERTY:  Guest shall occupy and use the rental property in a manner that shall not disturb or offend neighbors of the rental property. 

SENSITIVE MOUNTAIN SEPTIC:  Toilets:  The following items are NOT to be flushed down the toilets.  Baby wipes, facial wipes, diapers, tampons or any feminine products, Q-Tips, excessive toilet paper.  Should a toilet overflow and the plumber determines the cause was by any of the above items, guest will be charged the entire service call plus time and effort by owners.  Use the trash cans located beside the toilets.  

CARE OF PREMISES/DAMAGES:  NO PET PROPERTIES AND NO SMOKING – Violation of these or any of the House Rules constitutes grounds for automatic eviction plus forfeit of all payments and all booking/reservation costs if violated.   Guest agrees to pay Host for any damages to the property, grounds, furnishings, household items, hot tubs caused by Guest during its occupancy.  This will include payment of any additional cleaning charges incurred due to Guests  occupancy.   

PETS:  Depending on the property, well behaved adult dogs are considered.  No cats.  $100.00 non-refundable pet fee will be charged per stay.  Should your pet cause any damage or additional housekeeping is required for “accidents” in the house, additional costs will be incurred.    

BEFORE DEPARTING:  Please do the following before departing the property:  
1.	Furniture - If you moved it, please put it back. 
2.	Remote controls - make sure all remote controls are left visible in each room with a television, DVD player or other devices using a remote control.  
3.	Netflix and Streaming Services  - if you signed into your home accounts, remember to sign out.  
4.	Dishes, pots, pans, etc., must be washed and put away for the next guest.  If the Property has a dishwasher, please load, and turn it on.  
5.	Beds - If you slept in the bed, just leave it unmade.  DO NOT strip beds
6.	Towels - leave used towels in the bathtub, shower or on the floor.
7.	Lights, fans, and appliances should be turned off. 
8.	Garbage must be bagged and placed in the outside cans or containers or left inside the property.  
9.	Fireplaces - extinguish all fires in fireplaces and make sure safety screens are closed or in place. 	
10.	Thermostats - During cool season, set thermostat at 55 degrees upon departure

RESTRICTIONS:  The following activities are not permitted within the boundaries of the residential community or resort:  
1.	ATVs or snowmobiles* (Southern Properties excluded from this restriction)
2.	Discharge of firearms or use of archery tackle*
3.	Hunting or trapping*
4.	Outside fires, fireworks or any combustible substance are absolutely prohibited**
5.	Excessive noise that disrupts, disturbs, annoys, or offends neighbors*
6.	Sound curfew is 7:30 pm*
7.	Large recreational vehicles or large trailers 
a.	(Northern Properties – The roads are too narrow) 
8.	Parking anywhere except designated parking.  No street parking or parking in neighboring cabins or condos
9.	Open fires are strictly restricted outside – no firepits, bonfires or any such version of these and will be fined $2,500.00.

FINES OF UP TO $1,000.00 MAY BE ASSESSED FOR PROHIBITED ACTIVITES

Guest and Host, by signing this Rental Agreement acknowledges that they will comply with the terms of this Agreement and each assumes the responsibility for the obligations set forth herein.  Guest acknowledges receipt of the House Rules.  Guest acknowledges that they have read, accepts, and agrees to the terms set forth.
cancellationPolicy: Guests who cancel at least 30 days before check-in will get back 100% of the amount they've paid minus 5% credit card processing fees.  If they cancel between 14 and 30 days before check-in, they'll get back 50% minus 5% credit card processing fees.  Otherwise, they won't get a refund.

description.summary:
WR #13 is where you want to stay at  Eagle Point Ski Resort.  Seasonally all types of play await right outside the door.  Bring your toys!  Skiing, snowboarding, snowmobiling, timber sledding, rock climbing, hiking, biking, ATV the Paiute Trail, fish all five lakes,  stargaze, rent an off-road E-bike or paddle board a lake,. Or, how about making your friend an enemy at the paint ball course next to the Lodge?  Come Play. It's fun.  

Gorgeous 1 bd, 1 bath, sleeps four.  See it to believe it
description.notes:

Smoking is not permitted in the condo at all.  Please smoke in your vehicles or away from the unit.
description.transit: Winter months require four wheel or all wheel drive vehicles.  Eagle Point is a ski resort.  You'll be enjoying the peace and serenity of the mountains about 20 minutes away from Beaver, Utah.  Be sure to fill your gas tank in town before coming up the mountains all-wheel-drive + snow tires and a set of chains, just in case, are highly recommended in winter.

description.name: Eagle Point Ski Resort Nº15 Snowflake Condos
description.shortSummary: Eagle Point Ski Resort Nº15 Snowflake Condos
description.summary: Snowflake #15 is a ski-in/ski-out 2 bedroom, 2 bath, pus loft condo that sleeps 10 people. Queen bed in each bedroom, two  sets of twin size bed bunk beds in the loft, and a sleeper sofa for 2 in the living room.  Internet access, smart TVs,  is there for you to make your stay more enjoyable and comfortable.    A real wood-burning fireplace with dry wood and fire starters makes things extra cozy and convenient.
description.notes:
Located along the historic Paiute Trail in Utah’s Tushar Mountains, in the Eagle Point Ski Resort off of Hwy 153, our Mountain Cabins Utah Condos are true diamonds in the most spectacular rough!

A fully stocked kitchen provides everything you need to make yourself at home—cooking utensils, silverware, pots & pans, plates, bowls, cups, glasses, pizza pan, wine glasses, coffee maker, toaster, blender, dishwasher, and microwave.  You’ll find a starter supply of paper towels, dish soap, dishwasher soap, and trash bags for your use.   

The deck has plenty of room to sit outside and enjoy spectacular views of the ski slopes and breathe the clean air with a nice cup of coffee in the morning or a beverage of choice in the evening to watch the spectacular sunsets or look at the stars.
description.transit: Winter driving requires four wheel or all wheel drive vehicles.  Come prepared!
description.neighbourhood:
Any time of year, there’s no better place to escape the crowds than by booking a Mountain Cabins Utah Condo at Eagle Point Ski Resort. Located in the Fish Lake National Forest, at over 9,000’ above sea level, you can escape the heat of summer and breathe the cleanest air surrounded by tall quakie aspens and pine trees.  In the fall, come and watch the trees turn yellow and feel the crispness of the changing seasons.  In winter the solitude and beauty of the snow is like being in the movies. 

Summertime:  
Our Mountain Cabins Utah Condos provide untethered access to bucket list hiking, world-class fishing, clear water kayaking, paddle-boarding, mind-blowing mountain biking, and miles and miles of ATV trails for exploration, all within minutes of your front door.  Try frisbee golf or paintball at the Upper Eagle Point Lodge or enjoy golf or tennis in Beaver, just 20 minutes down the mountain.  Do you have horses?  Bring them up and ride the trails.  We have space for horse trailers and areas for you to tether them.   

Don’t forget your camera equipment because this is one of the most Instagram-worthy experiences you’ll ever find.  There’s truly no shortage of amazing sights and experiences to share with your followers over your Mountain Cabins Utah Condo and Eagle Point Ski Resort vacation (tag us @mtcabinsut and show other guests around using #mtcabinsutguest and #mtcabinsutguide)


Fires:  
Open flame fires are not permitted anywhere on the property.  Be very mindful of the level of forest fire danger. Remember Smokey the Bear - ONLY YOU can prevent forest fires.  

Wintertime: World-class skiing and snowboarding on the greatest snow on earth at Eagle Point Ski Resort is hard to beat. With access to 650 skiable acres and 40 named runs, ranging from tree-lined groomers to the steepest, most challenging runs in southern Utah, Eagle Point’s 5 lifts will provide each skill level of skier or snowboarder in your group with a fun-filled, action-packed day.  From the base elevation of 9,100’ to the summit elevation of 10,600’ there’s 1,500’ of elevation.  The small crowds, reasonable lift pricing, expert terrain, and spectacular views are unbeatable. 

The national forest lands surrounding Eagle Point Ski Resort are your playground for snowmobiling, timber sledding, and snow biking.  (Not permitted within the boundaries of the Resort). 

Endless trails for snowshoeing or cross-country skiing are also right outside the condos.  Take the little ones out for sledding, make snow angels, make a snowman or engage in a good old-fashioned snowball fight.   Bring your family and teach them how to ski and also get in plenty of verticals for yourself.

The Terrain Park, located by the Monarch Triple Chair Lift, is an ever-evolving creation of our residential Tzar of Creation, Mongo.  The addition of new snow-making equipment in 2019, created five different jumps and twelve rail features.  Come and try those tricks you saw on television and were told not to try at home.  Well, you’re not at home now, are you?  However, a bit of prudence and common sense might be a good rule of thumb. 

After a day on the slopes, enjoy a cup of hot cocoa by the warm fireplace (wood supplied) as you look out over the resort and let the memories you’re building really sink in and find a permanent home in your heart.  Or, let someone else do all the work and simply go to the Canyon Side Lodge to enjoy a fantastic meal with the family or a quiet wine or beverage in the bar. 

Winter Survival:  It is absolutely mandatory to drive vehicles with four-wheel or all-wheel drive, or you must have chains that you know how to put on.   In your parking space in front of the condo with your front-facing into the parking lot for easy exit.  Put your windshield wipers up away from the window for easier cleaning.  The snowplows usually come once a day in the morning.  HINT:  Remember in heavy snow, do not try to power your way out if you sense you are getting stuck.  Move forward a few inches, then back a few inches.  Slow and steady.  Never come up the mountain without a full tank of gas.  Never. 

Falling Snow and Ice:  Look up and be aware of what’s over your head.  Stairs can be very slippery and dangerous.  Wear appropriate shoes and clothing.  

At Your Condo:  Please do your part to conserve water and electricity that isn’t being used.  Please keep the doors and windows or screens closed to ensure the wildlife stays wild and you don’t.

Trash: If you have a lot of trash there is a dumpster on the left as you head to upper Eagle Point Lodge. There is also a dumpster available to the public near the mouth of Beaver Canyon.

Please, NO SMOKING in the Condos.

Entertainment:  While there is internet and satellite TV in Snowflake 15, we find that most guests come here to unplug and be entertained by the real greatest show on earth, Mother Nature.  Your home away from home has family games and books.  A Blue-Ray Player is available so bring your favorite movies to watch or that book you’ve wanted to read.  Cuddle up on the couch with a blanket and pillow and take an hour or two for yourself.  

Cell service is spotty so you’ll want to enable WiFi calling if you need to keep in touch with the world below.

Local Attractions:  Puffer Lake, 1.5 miles from the condo, is the nearest of nine lakes near the condo.  Plenty of fishing is available in the lakes or the many streams and rivers that flow through the area.  A half-day driving excursion on FR 135 off of Hwy 135 will acquaint you with all nine lakes and get you out in the stunningly beautiful forest and meadows. 

Groceries and Supplies:  Mike’s Food Town, is located at 270 N Main Street in Beaver. Stock up on essentials at Mike’s before you come up the mountain. SUGGESTION:  Stop at bigger stores for your specialty items in Cedar City if you’re coming from the south or Spanish Fork if coming from the north or do your major shopping at home.  Mike and his family have been the local grocer since 1980. 

Adult Beverage:  Beaver Spirits, is located at 710 N Main Street in Beaver.  Small but nice wine selection and also have great t-shirts for sale.  

Favorite Shops:   
***Sherwood Forest Candle & Gift Shop, (435) 438-0211
31 N Main Street, Beaver, Utah 84713

***This is where you can purchase the "Cup of Fire" fire starters used in our condo.

Beaver Sport and Pawn, (435) 438-0211
91 N Main St, Beaver, UT 84713
This is a “just because you have to see it”


The Creamery, (833) 796-4551
165 South 500 West, Beaver, UT 84713
Gifts, ice cream, cheese and more

Restaurants:
On the mountain:  

The Canyonside Bar & Grill serves Friday dinner service and Saturday lunch and dinner service mid-June through Labor Day Weekend.  

Beaver Area:  Maria’s Cocina (17 miles away at 1419 E Canyon Rd. - 435-438-5654) is our absolute favorite, must-try restaurant.  Opens Memorial Day Weekend through Labor Day Weekend.   Quaint Mexican Restaurant with Maria, herself, cooking in the back. Have to try it.  

Our Local Favorites: Beaver Taco, Craigo’s Pizza , the Timberline - for nice dine-in, Mel’s Diner for great burgers and shakes and The Creamery Cheese Factory.  And don’t forget Dairy Queen for dessert! 

Gatherings:   Mountain Cabins Utah Condos own a total of six condominiums in Eagle Point Ski Resort.  For your larger gatherings of groups or family and friends, consider renting multiple condos to sleep a total of 38 people in a total of 19 beds (including sleeper sofas).

Larger groups are no problem, just let us know and we’ll arrange everything for you.  How about that big family reunion waiting to happen, a beautiful destination wedding, corporate retreats/events, church functions, group trail rides, and hikes.  The ideas are endless but you can count on Mountain Cabins Utah Condos and Eagle Point Ski Resort to help you facilitate your biggest dreams.

description.name: Eagle Point Ski Resort Nº17 Snowflake Condos
description.shortSummary: Eagle Point Ski Resort Nº17Snowflake Condos
description.summary: Updated but true to that traditional charm that  you back to when you were a kid visiting Grandpa's mountain cabin.  Located in a resort that takes you back to a time when fun was plentiful, lift lines were minimal or non-existent, and nature was more valuable than electronics.
description.notes:
Located along the historic Paiute Trail in Utah’s Tushar Mountains, in the Eagle Point Ski Resort off of Hwy 153, our Mountain Cabins Utah Condos are true diamonds in the most spectacular rough!
Our Snowflake #17 is a beautiful ski-in/ski-out 2 bedroom, two-bath condo with a loft that sleeps 11 people.  A  Queen bed in each of the bedrooms, a corner unit bunk bed system in the loft sleeps 5 (including a trundle) plus a sleeper sofa for 2 in the living room!.  Everybody has a place to sleep.   Internet access, satellite TV plus a Blu-ray player is there for you to make your stay more enjoyable and comfortable.    A real wood-burning fireplace with dry wood and fire starters makes things extra cozy and convenient.   

Fully equipped kitchen including cooking utensils, silverware, pots & pans, plates, bowls, cups, glasses, pizza pan, wine glasses, coffee maker, toaster, blender, dishwasher, and microwave.  You’ll find a starter supply of paper towels, dish soap, dishwasher soap, and trash bags for your use.   

The deck has plenty of room to sit outside and enjoy spectacular views of the ski slopes and breathe the clean air with a nice cup of coffee in the morning or a beverage of choice in the evening to watch the sunset or look at the stars.
description.neighbourhood:
Eagle Point Resort & Area:  Any time of year, there’s no better place to escape the crowds than by booking a Mountain Cabins Utah Condo at Eagle Point Ski Resort. Located in the Fish Lake National Forest, at over 9,000’ above sea level, you can escape the heat of summer and breathe the cleanest air surrounded by tall quakie aspens and pine trees.  In the fall, come and watch the trees turn yellow and feel the crispness of the changing seasons.  In winter the solitude and beauty of the snow is like being in the movies. 

Summertime:  Our Mountain Cabins Utah Condos provide untethered access to bucket list hiking, world-class fishing, clear water kayaking, paddle-boarding, mind-blowing mountain biking and miles and miles of ATV trails for exploration, all within minutes of your front door.  Try frisbee golf or enjoy golf or tennis in Beaver, just 20 minutes down the mountain.  Do you have horses?  Bring them up and ride the trails.  We have space for horse trailers and areas for you to tether them.   

Fires:  Open flame fires are not permitted anywhere on the property.  Be very mindful of the level of forest fire danger. Remember Smokey the Bear - ONLY YOU can prevent forest fires.  

Wintertime: World-class skiing and snowboarding on the greatest snow on earth at Eagle Point Ski Resort is hard to beat. With access to 650 skiable acres and 40 named runs, ranging from tree-lined groomers to the steepest, most challenging runs in southern Utah, Eagle Point’s 5 lifts will provide each skill level of skier or snowboarder in your group with a fun-filled, action-packed day.  From the base elevation of 9,100’ to the summit elevation of 10,600’ there’s 1,500’ of elevation.  The small crowds, reasonable lift pricing, expert terrain, and spectacular views are unbeatable. 

The national forest lands surrounding Eagle Point Ski Resort are your playground for snowmobiling, timber sledding, and snow biking.  (Not permitted within the boundaries of the Resort). 

Endless trails for snowshoeing or cross-country skiing are also right outside the condos.  Take the little ones out for sledding, make snow angels, make a snowman or engage in a good old-fashioned snowball fight.   Bring your family and teach them how to ski and also get in plenty of verticals for yourself.

The addition of new snow-making equipment in 2019, created five different jumps and twelve rail features.  Come and try those tricks you saw on television and were told not to try at home.  Well, you’re not at home now, are you?  However, a bit of prudence and common sense might be a good rule of thumb. 

After a day on the slopes, enjoy a cup of hot cocoa by the warm fireplace (wood supplied) as you look out over the resort and let the memories you’re building really sink in and find a permanent home in your heart.  

Winter Survival:  It is absolutely mandatory to drive vehicles with four-wheel or all-wheel drive, or you must have chains that you know how to put on.   In your parking space in front of the condo with your front-facing into the parking lot for easy exit.  Put your windshield wipers up away from the window for easier cleaning.  The snow plows usually come once a day in the morning.  HINT:  Remember in heavy snow, do not try to power your way out if you sense you are getting stuck.  Move forward a few inches, then backward a few inches.  Slow and steady.  Never come up the mountain without a full tank of gas.  Never. 

Falling Snow and Ice:  Look up and be aware of what’s over your head.  Stairs can be very slippery and dangerous.  Wear appropriate shoes and clothing.  

At Your Condo:  Please do your part to conserve water and electricity that isn’t being used.  Please keep the doors and windows or screens closed to ensure the wildlife stays wild and you don’t.

Trash: If you have a lot of trash there is a dumpster on the left as you head to upper Eagle Point Lodge. There is also a dumpster available to the public near the mouth of Beaver Canyon.

Please, NO SMOKING in the Condos.

Entertainment:  While there is internet and satellite TV in Wooded Ridge #6, we find that most guests come here to unplug and be entertained by the real greatest show on earth, Mother Nature.  Your home away from home has family games and books.  A Blue-Ray Player is available so bring your favorite movies to watch or that book you’ve wanted to read.  Cuddle up on the couch with a blanket and pillow and take an hour or two for yourself.  

Cell service is spotty so you’ll want to enable WiFi calling if you need to keep in touch with the world below.

Local Attractions:  Puffer Lake, 1.5 miles from the condo, is the nearest of nine lakes near the condo.  Plenty of fishing is available in the lakes or the many streams and rivers that flow through the area.  A half-day driving excursion on FR 135 off of Hwy 135 will acquaint you with all nine lakes and get you out in the stunningly beautiful forest and meadows. 

Groceries and Supplies:  Mike’s Food Town, is located at 270 N Main Street in Beaver. Stock up on essentials at Mike’s before you come up the mountain. SUGGESTION:  Stop at bigger stores for your specialty items in Cedar City if you’re coming from the south or Spanish Fork if coming from the north or do your major shopping at home.  Mike and his family have been the local grocer since 1980. 

Adult Beverage:  Beaver Spirits, is located at 710 N Main Street in Beaver.  Small but nice wine selection and also have great t-shirts for sale.  

Favorite Shops:   
***Sherwood Forest Candle & Gift Shop, (435) 438-0211
31 N Main Street, Beaver, Utah 84713

***This is where you can purchase the "Cup of Fire" fire starters used in our condo.

Beaver Sport and Pawn, (435) 438-0211
91 N Main St, Beaver, UT 84713
This is a “just because you have to see it”


The Creamery, (833) 796-4551
165 South 500 West, Beaver, UT 84713
Gifts, ice cream, cheese and more

Restaurants:
On the mountain:  

The Canyonside Bar & Grill serves Friday dinner service and Saturday lunch and dinner service mid June through Labor Day Weekend.  

Beaver Area:  Maria’s Cocina (17 miles away at 1419 E Canyon Rd. - 435-438-5654) is our absolute favorite, must try restaurant.  Opens Memorial Day Weekend through Labor Day Weekend.   Quaint Mexican Restaurant with Maria, herself, cooking in the back. Have to try it.  

Our Local Favorites: Beaver Taco, Craigo’s Pizza , the Timberline - for nice dine-in, Mel’s Diner for great burgers and shakes and The Creamery Cheese Factory.  And don’t forget Dairy Queen for desert! 

Gatherings:   Mountain Cabins Utah Condos own a total of six condominiums in Eagle Point Ski Resort.  For your larger gatherings of groups or family and friends, consider renting multiple condos to sleep a total of 38 people in a total of 19 beds (including sleeper sofas).

Larger groups are no problem, just let us know and we’ll arrange everything for you.  How about that big family reunion waiting to happen, a beautiful destination wedding, corporate retreats/events, church functions, group trail rides, and hikes.  The ideas are endless but you can count on Mountain Cabins Utah Condos and Eagle Point Ski Resort to help you facilitate your biggest dreams.

rentalCondition:
PROPERTY CONDITIONS 

AGE REQUIREMENT:  Guest is at least twenty-five (25) years of age.  Guest is responsible for all other guests and visitors of the rental property during the reservation.  

PAYMENT:  50% of the total reservation amount is due at time of booking.  30 Days prior to arrival, the balance is due.  Should final payment not be made 30 days prior to arrival, the reservation may be cancelled, and any payment made becomes non-refundable.  

LIMITED OCCUPANCY:  Maximum occupancy is limited to the number of individuals listed on the reservation.  If the host concludes that this policy has been breached, Host reserves the right to expel the entire party with no refund.  

TERM OF RENTAL AGREEMENT:  The Rental Agreement begins at 4:00 p.m. on Check-in Date and ends at 11:00 a.m. on Check out Date.  Early check-ins or late check-outs are subject to approval.  

CANCELLATION POLICY:  Guests who cancel at least 30 days before check-in will get back 100% of the amount.  Should a reservation be rescheduled at the request of the guest or recommendation of the Host, and then cancelled, the payment made would not be refundable.  

SMOKING:  No smoking inside the property.  A minimum fee of $250 will be assessed if smoking in the property is detected.  

PARKING:  Is restricted to the properties designated spaces.  Do not park in neighboring properties.  There is room for your trailers with your outdoor toys.  Please be considerate of neighbors.  

REFUNDS:  Guest hereby agrees and acknowledges that guest shall not be entitled to a refund in the event guest departs before the end of the reservation or guest arrives late.  Furthermore, any refund or compensation for the occurrence of any and all events out of the control of Owners, including but not limited to, Acts of God, weather conditions, power outages, water outages, mechanical failure of appliances and electronics, heat and air will be at the sole discretion of Owners.  Mountain roads can be curvy and steep.  Gravel drives and roads are well maintained; however, it is highly recommended to have four-wheel drive or chains on two-wheel-drive vehicles.  No refunds will be given due to road conditions. 

HOSTS RIGHTS:  Guest agrees that if the conditions and limitations set forth herein are not met, Host shall have the right to cancel this agreement and may enter the Property, either by statutory proceedings or by force, to inspect the Property and ensure that Guest has vacated the Property.  All monies paid by the Guest shall be forfeited as liquidated damages.  

INDEMNIITY CLAUSE:  Guest hereby agrees to indemnify and hold Host harmless from all claims, including those of third parties, arising out of or in any way related to Guest’s use of Property or the items of personal property provided therein.  Guest assumes all risk of injury or other losses relating to any recreational activities, including use of hot tub on the Property and will hold Host harmless with respect therein.  

REPAIRS AND MAINTENANCE:  This property is reserved wit the Host’s furniture and household furnishings.  Host shall not be responsible for providing additional furnishings or equipment not presently available in Property.  Guest will report any maintenance issues immediately to the Host.  Host will make every effort to repair and/or replace any equipment that is not working property but cannot guarantee that all equipment will be in good operating order at all times and no rate adjustments or refund will be made for equipment or appliance failures.  

USE OF RENTAL PROPERTY:  Guest shall occupy and use the rental property in a manner that shall not disturb or offend neighbors of the rental property. 

SENSITIVE MOUNTAIN SEPTIC:  Toilets:  The following items are NOT to be flushed down the toilets.  Baby wipes, facial wipes, diapers, tampons or any feminine products, Q-Tips, excessive toilet paper.  Should a toilet overflow and the plumber determines the cause was by any of the above items, guest will be charged the entire service call plus time and effort by owners.  Use the trash cans located beside the toilets.  

CARE OF PREMISES/DAMAGES:  NO PET PROPERTIES AND NO SMOKING – Violation of these or any of the House Rules constitutes grounds for automatic eviction plus forfeit of all payments and all booking/reservation costs if violated.   Guest agrees to pay Host for any damages to the property, grounds, furnishings, household items, hot tubs caused by Guest during its occupancy.  This will include payment of any additional cleaning charges incurred due to Guests  occupancy.   

PETS:  Depending on the property, well behaved adult dogs are considered.  No cats.  $100.00 non-refundable pet fee will be charged per stay.  Should your pet cause any damage or additional housekeeping is required for “accidents” in the house, additional costs will be incurred.    

BEFORE DEPARTING:  Please do the following before departing the property:  
1.	Furniture - If you moved it, please put it back. 
2.	Remote controls - make sure all remote controls are left visible in each room with a television, DVD player or other devices using a remote control.  
3.	Netflix and Streaming Services  - if you signed into your home accounts, remember to sign out.  
4.	Dishes, pots, pans, etc., must be washed and put away for the next guest.  If the Property has a dishwasher, please load, and turn it on.  
5.	Beds - If you slept in the bed, just leave it unmade.  DO NOT strip beds
6.	Towels - leave used towels in the bathtub, shower or on the floor.
7.	Lights, fans, and appliances should be turned off. 
8.	Garbage must be bagged and placed in the outside cans or containers or left inside the property.  
9.	Fireplaces - extinguish all fires in fireplaces and make sure safety screens are closed or in place. 	
10.	Thermostats - During cool season, set thermostat at 55 degrees upon departure

RESTRICTIONS:  The following activities are not permitted within the boundaries of the residential community or resort:  
1.	ATVs or snowmobiles* (Southern Properties excluded from this restriction)
2.	Discharge of firearms or use of archery tackle*
3.	Hunting or trapping*
4.	Outside fires, fireworks or any combustible substance are absolutely prohibited**
5.	Excessive noise that disrupts, disturbs, annoys, or offends neighbors*
6.	Sound curfew is 7:30 pm*
7.	Large recreational vehicles or large trailers 
a.	(Northern Properties – The roads are too narrow) 
8.	Parking anywhere except designated parking.  No street parking or parking in neighboring cabins or condos
9.	Open fires are strictly restricted outside – no firepits, bonfires or any such version of these and will be fined $2,500.00.

FINES OF UP TO $1,000.00 MAY BE ASSESSED FOR PROHIBITED ACTIVITES

Guest and Host, by signing this Rental Agreement acknowledges that they will comply with the terms of this Agreement and each assumes the responsibility for the obligations set forth herein.  Guest acknowledges receipt of the House Rules.  Guest acknowledges that they have read, accepts, and agrees to the terms set forth.

description.summary: Come and stay in Wooded Ridge #9 while visiting the great outdoor surrounding Eagle Point Ski Resort.  Your full day of  the Paute ATV trails, fishing, hiking, biking, skiing, snowboarding, snow mobiling or  whatever is bringing you here, can be based from this ski in/ski out one bedroom condo.  Watch the sunrise in the morning, and the spectacular sunsets in the evening.
description.notes: Smoking is not permitted in the condo at all.  Please smoke in your vehicles or away from the unit.
description.transit: You'll be enjoying the peace and serenity of the mountains about 20 minutes away from Beaver, Utah.  Be sure to fill your gas tank in town before coming up the mountains.  From November through March all-wheel-drive + snow tires and a set of chains, just in case, are highly recommended.
description.interaction: We're available by phone and by text throughout the week, and on-site personnel will always be assigned on the weekends.
description.neighbourhood: Located in the Tusher Mountains of Southern Utah, along the historic Paiute Trail, Eagle Point Ski Resort is a true diamond in the rough, with no end to great experiences for every member of the family to unplug and build cherished mountain memories to last a lifetime!
description.space: Entire condominium is for your use.  Designated parking spaces are directly in front of the Condo.  If you bring a trailer with your adult topys, there's parallel parking space next to the hill across from the condo.  Please leave room for your neighbors.

amenities.title: Very Private Cabin
amenities.description: Enjoy relaxing privacy at the Hideaway. IMPORTANT: Accessible only via 62 stairs or 4-Wheel-Drive in the summer, and only via the stairs in the winter.

amenities.title: Parking
amenities.description: Parking is available with 4X4 right up to the front door, or regular vehicle with access via the stair case above.

amenities.title: 1 Queen Sized Bed
amenities.description: Enjoy luxury comfort on this quality mattress but be warned: You may not want to go back home, and this bed won't fit in your carry on luggage 🙂

amenities.title: 6 Kids Beds
amenities.description: Kids beds include a bunk bed in the master bedroom, two twin beds and two trundle beds upstairs.

amenities.title: Walk to Sundance Mountain Resort
amenities.description: About 3 minutes easy walk from Sundance Mountain Resort, voted "Utah's Best Resort 2017" by Conde` Nest Traveler.

amenities.title: Local Attractions
amenities.description: Enjoy Mt Biking, Skiing, Fly Fishing, Hiking, Mountain Concerts, Theater, Fine Dining, Art Gallery & Classes, Zip Lines, Water Falls, The Spa & Staying In!

amenities.title: Jacuzzi / Hot Tub
amenities.description: Spend the days exploring Sundance Mountain Resort and all the hikes, biking, skiing, fly fishing and sights in the area, then relax those tired muscles in your own, private hot tub jacuzzi.

amenities.title: Amazing Views
amenities.description: The Hideaway is surrounded by Big Pines and a beautiful, year round steam creating views from two decks that our guests describe as "story book views" they can't believe actually exist.

amenities.title: Propane BBQ Grill
amenities.description: Dine out at Sundance Resort Restaurants like The Tree Room, Foundry Grill, or the Owl Bar, or... Grill a treat and dine in with your own propane BBQ grill just outside the door.

description.name: Hideaway Above The Stream • Sundance, Utah
description.shortSummary: Hideaway Above The Stream • Sundance, Utah
description.summary:
Take the stairs down from the parking area and enjoy the seclusion, privacy, and solitude of the Hideaway.  The stream below flows year-round.  Sit on the deck in the summer and watch the wildlife in the meadow or  sit in the hot tub in the winter and watch the snow fall.      

Only five minutes to the Resort's ski lifts, hiking & biking trails, zip line, and do not forget the Spa and the amazing restaurants, and, only a five minute drive.
description.notes: Ultimate privacy for anyone who really wants to get away!  Accessible only via 59 step staircase in winter, and All Wheel Drive to front door in Summer.  Not ideal if you have trouble with stars, but please check out our other properties for easy access.

description.name: Log Cabin On The Stream • Sundance, Utah
description.shortSummary: Five minutes to Sundance Ski Resort
description.summary:
This Log Cabin is a classic.  A great room with wood burning fireplace (wood provided), a large kitchen for meal creations, dining area for all, 5 bedrooms,  3 bathrooms, a Man Cave and a Hot Tub over the creek plus a Gazebo for lounging.   Tall skylights and windows bring the outside in.  All of this is for you to enjoy.  During the summer, the horseshoe pit and corn hole games in the common area to the right of the cabin is yours to enjoy.  You will have room to park up to six vehicles and should you need more, contact Pamela to arrange.  


The kitchen has top of the line cabinets, dishwasher, two ovens, microwave and The whimsical under stairs “mud room” features coat hooks at all levels to keep outside gear in one place for people of all sizes. The main level covered deck has seating and is a great gathering place to talk and drink hot chocolate.  

Every bedroom has a little something different. Top level bedroom features skylights for looking at the stars at night or watching it snow and has a queen bed plus twin bed with a trundle for keeping the little ones near. A balcony and outside door to upper deck lets you view the outdoors or let the fresh air in. The adjacent bathroom with tub/shower has granite counter tops and vanity mirror.
 
Main level bedroom features a window seat for reading the novel you brought along, an exterior door to the upper deck, direct access to bathroom, television, queen size bed.  A large walk in closet plus adjacent bathroom is very convenient.  In the closet is one set of washer/dryers in the cabin.  Second set downstairs.  

One bedroom on the lower level has two queen beds plus two closets and plenty of space for clothes. This room is fun for sleep-over style for teenagers. This window is on ground level with three larges windows for lots of light.

Second bedroom downstairs has two twin beds, ground level windows and large closet and is adjacent to the exterior door on ground level.  

The master bedroom has a California King size bed, television, two chairs for relaxing and an exterior door leading to the hot tub and the bathroom is across the hall.  Size and easy access make this a “favorite” room.

And then there’s the Man Cave. Television, pool table, card table and the ever popular Monopoly pinball machine make this a favorite gathering spot.  wo exterior doors, one to to the outside lower decks, gazebo and hot tub and the second for bringing in food and beverages makes this an easy room to entertain in.
description.notes: Sundance resort is a mere 1.2 miles away.  A super quick drive or nice walk.  The Sundance resort has restaurants, a bar, skiing, summer sports, a zipline and more.
description.access: During the winter (Nov through March) four wheel or all wheel drive vehicles are required. Summer  - just come and stay.
description.transit: Sundance resort is a mere 1.2 miles away.  A super quick drive or nice walk.  The Sundance resort has restaurants, a bar, skiing, summer sports, a zipline and more.  Plan to drive a vehicle as Uber and other services are not readily available.
description.interaction: Living on the mountain and only a five minute walk away, we are available for any and all questions or concerns you may have.  Just give us a call.  512-413-4380.  Pamela prefers to keep in touch via text message for quick communication about local events.  Road closures, weather conditions or other "need to know" information witll be messaged to you via text.
description.neighbourhood: You're in the heart of the beautiful Wasatch mountains.  Mount Timpanogas  stands tall over Sundance while gorgeous pine trees are everywhere you look.  Take a seat next to stream, take in the mountain air and relax.  Summer months brings music, theatre, ziplining, hiking, biking, horseback riding to our back door.  Winter brings skiing, snowboarding, (both day and night) and snow shoeing on trails at the Nordic Center.  This is a great community far enough away to be far away but yet close enough to little towns and other activities.

name: Stewart Heights
rentalCondition:
PROPERTY CONDITIONS 

AGE REQUIREMENT:  Guest is at least twenty-five (25) years of age.  Guest is responsible for all other guests and visitors of the rental property during the reservation.  

PAYMENT:  50% of the total reservation amount is due at time of booking.  30 Days prior to arrival, the balance is due.  Should final payment not be made 30 days prior to arrival, the reservation may be cancelled, and any payment made becomes non-refundable.  

LIMITED OCCUPANCY:  Maximum occupancy is limited to the number of individuals listed on the reservation.  If the host concludes that this policy has been breached, Host reserves the right to expel the entire party with no refund.  

TERM OF RENTAL AGREEMENT:  The Rental Agreement begins at 4:00 p.m. on Check-in Date and ends at 11:00 a.m. on Check out Date.  Early check-ins or late check-outs are subject to approval.  

CANCELLATION POLICY:  Guests who cancel at least 30 days before check-in will get back 100% of the amount.  Should a reservation be rescheduled at the request of the guest or recommendation of the Host, and then cancelled, the payment made would not be refundable.  

SMOKING:  No smoking inside the property.  A minimum fee of $250 will be assessed if smoking in the property is detected.  

PARKING:  Is restricted to the properties designated spaces.  Do not park in neighboring properties or in the road. 

REFUNDS:  Guest hereby agrees and acknowledges that guest shall not be entitled to a refund in the event guest departs before the end of the reservation or guest arrives late.  Furthermore, any refund or compensation for the occurrence of any and all events out of the control of Owners, including but not limited to, Acts of God, weather conditions, power outages, water outages, mechanical failure of appliances and electronics, heat and air will be at the sole discretion of Owners.  Mountain roads can be curvy and steep.  Gravel drives and roads are well maintained; however, it is highly recommended to have four-wheel drive or chains on two-wheel-drive vehicles.  No refunds will be given due to road conditions. 

HOSTS RIGHTS:  Guest agrees that if the conditions and limitations set forth herein are not met, Host shall have the right to cancel this agreement and may enter the Property, either by statutory proceedings or by force, to inspect the Property and ensure that Guest has vacated the Property.  All monies paid by the Guest shall be forfeited as liquidated damages.  

INDEMNIITY CLAUSE:  Guest hereby agrees to indemnify and hold Host harmless from all claims, including those of third parties, arising out of or in any way related to Guest’s use of Property or the items of personal property provided therein.  Guest assumes all risk of injury or other losses relating to any recreational activities, including use of hot tub on the Property and will hold Host harmless with respect therein.  

REPAIRS AND MAINTENANCE:  This property is reserved wit the Host’s furniture and household furnishings.  Host shall not be responsible for providing additional furnishings or equipment not presently available in Property.  Guest will report any maintenance issues immediately to the Host.  Host will make every effort to repair and/or replace any equipment that is not working property but cannot guarantee that all equipment will be in good operating order at all times and no rate adjustments or refund will be made for equipment or appliance failures.  

USE OF RENTAL PROPERTY:  Guest shall occupy and use the rental property in a manner that shall not disturb or offend neighbors of the rental property. 

SENSITIVE MOUNTAIN SEPTIC:  Toilets:  The following items are NOT to be flushed down the toilets.  Baby wipes, facial wipes, diapers, tampons or any feminine products, Q-Tips, excessive toilet paper.  Should a toilet overflow and the plumber determines the cause was by any of the above items, guest will be charged the entire service call plus time and effort by owners.  Use the trash cans located beside the toilets.  

CARE OF PREMISES/DAMAGES:  NO PET PROPERTIES AND NO SMOKING – Violation of these or any of the House Rules constitutes grounds for automatic eviction plus forfeit of all payments and all booking/reservation costs if violated.   Guest agrees to pay Host for any damages to the property, grounds, furnishings, household items, hot tubs caused by Guest during its occupancy.  This will include payment of any additional cleaning charges incurred due to Guests  occupancy.   

PETS:  Depending on the property, well behaved adult dogs are considered.  No cats.  $100.00 non-refundable pet fee will be charged per stay.  Should your pet cause any damage or additional housekeeping is required for “accidents” in the house, additional costs will be incurred.    

BEFORE DEPARTING:  Please do the following before departing the property:  
1.	Furniture - If you moved it, please put it back. 
2.	Remote controls - make sure all remote controls are left visible in each room with a television, DVD player or other devices using a remote control.  
3.	Netflix and Streaming Services  - if you signed into your home accounts, remember to sign out.  
4.	Dishes, pots, pans, etc., must be washed and put away for the next guest.  If the Property has a dishwasher, please load, and turn it on.  
5.	Beds - If you slept in the bed, just leave it unmade.  DO NOT strip beds
6.	Towels - leave used towels in the bathtub, shower or on the floor.
7.	Lights, fans, and appliances should be turned off. 
8.	Garbage must be bagged and placed in the outside cans or containers or left inside the property.  
9.	Fireplaces - extinguish all fires in fireplaces and make sure safety screens are closed or in place. 	
10.	Thermostats - During cool season, set thermostat at 55 degrees upon departure

RESTRICTIONS:  The following activities are not permitted within the boundaries of the residential community or resort:  
1.	ATVs or snowmobiles* (Southern Properties excluded from this restriction)
2.	Discharge of firearms or use of archery tackle*
3.	Hunting or trapping*
4.	Outside fires, fireworks or any combustible substance are absolutely prohibited**
5.	Excessive noise that disrupts, disturbs, annoys, or offends neighbors*
6.	Sound curfew is 7:30 pm*
7.	Large recreational vehicles or large trailers 
a.	(Northern Properties – The roads are too narrow) 
8.	Parking anywhere except designated parking.  No street parking or parking in neighboring cabins or condos
9.	Open fires are strictly restricted outside – no firepits, bonfires or any such version of these and will be fined $2,500.00.

FINES OF UP TO $1,000.00 MAY BE ASSESSED FOR PROHIBITED ACTIVITES

Guest and Host, by signing this Rental Agreement acknowledges that they will comply with the terms of this Agreement and each assumes the responsibility for the obligations set forth herein.  Guest acknowledges receipt of the House Rules.  Guest acknowledges that they have read, accepts, and agrees to the terms set forth.
cancellationPolicy: Guests who cancel at least 30 days before check-in will get back 100% of the amount they've paid, minus 5%  to cover credit  card processing fees.   If they cancel between 14 and 30 days before check-in, they'll get back 50% minus 5% to cover processing fees. Otherwise, they won't get a refund.

description.name: Stewart Heights • Sundance, Utah
description.shortSummary: Mountains and views are center stage at Stewart Heights
description.summary: Escape to the serenity of Stewart Heights, a distinguished mountain home perched on a hillside with spectacular views.  A captivating blend of rustic elegance and modern comforts, this perfect getaway provides two levels for families traveling together and extra space to breathe, think, and fosters a sense of tranquility and relaxation for all.  Have a conversation, play a game, watch a movie, reconnect with each other.  It’s about taking time out.  Take it!
description.access: Stewart Heights has a small apartment below the garage with a separate entrance  that is rented by a chef at Sundance Ski Resort.  This person is quiet, and works long hours.  You'll most likely not even know hethe parking space to the right in front of the driveway for his use.  Thank you.
description.transit:
Car Rental is best.  
WINTER - From November 1st until March 31st, four wheel or all wheel drive is mandatory.
description.interaction: We live on the mountain and you call anytime with questions and concerns you may have.  If you can't find something or need something, please call.  Your time away is valuable and we appreciate you coming to stay with us.
description.neighbourhood: Located in a gated community within a five minute drive to the  Sundance Mountain Resort.  There you will find award winning restaurants such as The Foundry Grill that serves breakfast, lunch and dinner; The  TreeRoom for that extra special dining experience; The Owl Bar with burgers and the best staff ever and music on the weekends. (Adults only); or stop at the Deli for sandwiches, soup, coffee, smoothies, cookies and goodies.  The Deli also has those necessities you may need like milk, eggs, bread and a great steak or two.  If you're skiing, (or not) try out the OutLook AspreSki Restaurant for lunch and in the summer's will take you to the BearClaw Cabin at the top of the mountain where you can sit in the sun and enjoy the 360 degree views of Heber Valley and Provo Canyon.
description.space: The entire house is yours to use, except the apartment for the Chef.  HIs area is marked to not disturb.  Thank you for that consideration.

description.name: Sundance Mountain Haven • Sundance, Utah
description.shortSummary: Spacious Family Home  with Views, Hot Tub , Fireplaces, Decks and a Kid Cubby
description.summary: Sundance Mountain Haven has quick, easy access to ski runs in the winter and hiking trails in the summer invite you to go out and play.   Multi generations can enjoy the cabin at the same time.  Kid cubby to hide from adults, ping pong, shuffleboard, pool table for big kids, well-appointed kitchen for cooking, quiet bedrooms for relaxing and the hot tub on the deck for a relaxing soak.  Large living room for movies or sports games.  Come stay in this magical place and make new memories.
description.notes:
The bedroom with the four twin beds has the pool table in the middle.  This is  not a private bedroom with doors.  

The Kid Cubby Loft is the bedroom with two single beds.  It has a kid size entrance  that opens into a space for kids to play and sleep or watch tv in main living room from their perch.  

CAR CHARGING STATIONS ARE AVAILABLE IN THE UPPER PARKING LOT OF SUNDANCE RESORT.  
NO EVENTS HOSTED AT THIS PROPERTY.  
NO PETS.

description.interaction: Pamela and Lynn live here on the mountain and are always available by phone or text for any questiions, recommndations and assistance you might need.
description.neighbourhood: Located in a gated community within a five minute drive to the Sundance Resort. There you will find award winning restaurants such as The Foundry Grill that serves breakfast, lunch and dinner; The TreeRoom for that extra special dining experience; The Owl Bar with burgers and the best staff ever and music on the weekends. (Adults only); or stop at the Deli for sandwiches, soup, coffee, smoothies, cookies and goodies. The Deli also has those necessities you may need like milk, eggs, bread and a great steak or two. If you're skiing, (or not) try out the OutLook AspreSki Restaurant for lunch.

description.name: The Cuckoo's Nest  • Sundance, Utah
description.shortSummary: The Cuckoo's Nest - A great  place to perch awhile
description.summary: The Cuckoo's Nest is newly renovated and redecorated and is situated at the end of the road with spectacular views of the mountains and the ski lift at the Resort.  Four bedrooms in the main house with two adjoining but separate ensuite bedrooms plus a separate garage apartment invites families and groups to gather.
description.notes:
A gourmet chef's kitche features top of the line appliances, fully stocked with serving ware, and large pantry invite the chefs amoung you to come and create while the dining table and kitchen seating allow room for all to partake and enjoy.  The open kitchen plan allows for staying connected while others gather in the living room, parlour or family room nearby.  

The beauty of this home's interior will captivate you but don't forget the hot tub and the many decks for enjoying the crisp mountain air and don't forget the views.  You have to come and see for yourself.  

The surrounding mountains and Resort have plenty to offer.  Hiking, biking, skiing, snowshoeing, horseback riding, zip lining, music events, the spa, world class dining are all within a five to sevin minute drive.
description.transit:
Car Rental is best.  
WINTER - From November 1st until March 31st, four wheel or all wheel drive is mandatory.
description.interaction: The staff here at Mountain Cabins Utah live on the mountain and are here to answer any questions or be available to resolve any situations or problems that may come up.  Your time away is important to us and we will endeavor to make it more than you expected.
